project.name: Gentoo MIPS
project.description: The Gentoo/MIPS Project provides the Gentoo GNU/Linux operating system for mips-based platforms.
project.longdescription: Gentoo/MIPS is a port of the Gentoo GNU/Linux and the Gentoo Portage package management system to mips-based platforms. Primary focus is on the Silicon Graphics (SGI) line of mips-based workstations, specifically the Indy and Indigo2. Support is also available for the Cobalt Mincroserver Qube2/RaQ2 units and the SGI O2 R5000 units.

body.p: It's been awhile since the last update to the site, so people are likely wondering what all has been going on recently. For starters, we have a new developer to join the team, Hardave Riar. He joined a couple weeks ago to assist in various porting tasks, but will also assist in Octane work as Linux support for the system becomes better.

Newer stages for the 2004.2 release are available at the following locations:
SGI: http://dev.gentoo.org/~kumba/mips/releases/2004.2/
Cobalt: http://dev.gentoo.org/~kumba/mips/cobalt/releases/2004.2/
The official release date for 2004.2 was missed, so the stages are only on the above site for now. 2004.3 should be our next official release.
We have yet another new developer to join the MIPS ranks! Stephen Becker, a.k.a. geoman, will also work on Xfree86/Desktop related stuff, with Bret (psi29a).

We have a new developer to join the MIPS ranks. Please give a warm welcome to Bret Curtis, a.k.a., psi29a. Bret will be handling stuff in the Xfree86 and Desktop related sections, like KDE, Gaim, X-Chat and such. extraproject.name: Stages/Netboot
extraproject.p: Creation of the Gentoo/MIPS stages for installation. A stage tarball is a UNIX compressed tar archive of a chrootable environment for installing Gentoo.
Netboot images are for the initial booting of an environment to unpack the stages and install Gentoo.

extraproject.name: SGI O2 Porting
extraproject.p: The stabilization of the linux kernel on SGI O2 systems and sucessful installation and running of Gentoo/MIPS in a multi-user environment. If you have an SGI O2 with an R5000 or R12000 CPU and wish to help with this subproject, then this is the team you will want to contact.

extraproject.name: Cobalt Mips
extraproject.p: Creation of installation stages and documentation for installing Gentoo/MIPS on the Cobalt Microserver RaQ[2]/Qube[2] machines.

extraproject.name: LiveCD
extraproject.p: The creation and maintainence of a LiveCD for installing Gentoo/MIPS.

extrachapter.title: Installation Guide, Mailing Lists, and IRC Channel

body.p:
Those interested in running Gentoo/MIPS on an SGI mips-based system can get started by reading the
Installation Guide. Help can be obtained by subscribing to the gentoo-mips mailing list. More information about subscribing to a Gentoo mailing list can be found on the Mailing Lists page.
Those with access to an IRC Client can join #gentoo-mips on irc.freenode.net for general questions, help, or just to talk with others using Gentoo/MIPS.
